HELP.DESCRIPTION: This page presents help about the basic operation of the application. At the top of the application, there are menus to select the different views. Moreover, a button to select the language of the application between english or spanish. The application is mainly composed of the following 3 main views. The following is the help map:
HELP.TIMESERIES_TO_VIEW: Selection for the time series to be displayed
HELP.DEMAND_DESC: In the "Charts" view, a date and time selector and a button to reload data that predicts demand, production and emissions models are shown at the selected instant and meteorological data. The right side of the graphs shows the MAPE metric for the 24-hour time range selected in the date selector. The following figures show examples of the charts for the demand, production and emissions views. An example for the demand view is shown below:
HELP.PRODUCTION_DESC: An example for the energy production view is shown below:
HELP.EMISSIONS_DESC: An example for the carbon emissions view is shown below:
HELP.TABLE_DESC: Regarding the "Table" view, the same data shown in the graphs is broken down numerically. The following figure shows an example of the table screen.
HELP.SEARCH_FILTER_DESC: A filter function is implemented that allows agile searches on the loaded data. An example is shown below:
HELP.CSV_EXPORT_DESC1: Additionally, a button is implemented to export the loaded data to a CSV file. This button is shown in the following figure:
HELP.CSV_EXPORT_DESC2: Once the button is clicked, the user must choose a name and a directory, and accept or cancel the export.
HELP.SIMULATION_DESC: Finally, a simulation model is implemented for the equivalent carbon dioxide emissions produced by the production sources: carbon, combined cycle, cogeneration, diesel engines, gas turbine and steam turbine, which represent approximately 30% of the installed power in Spain and almost all the energies that emit polluting gases. The following figure shows an example of the emissions view, by means of the selectors the emissions can be simulated depending on the power generated that has been selected.
HELP.TIMESERIE_DESC: The user can at any time select the time series to be displayed on each graph. To activate or deactivate a time series, just click on the name of the series as shown in the following figure:
HELP.CALENDAR_DESC: Regarding the calendar, it is allowed to select dates between the range 19/09/2023 and 18/09/2024, i.e. the second year of the available data. The first year has been used to train the models and is therefore not available.
HELP.DATETIME_DESC: Next, you can select the start time from which the preconditions will be performed. Next to the date and time of the predictions a button for updating the predictions is placed.
HELP.LANGUAGE_DESC: The language selector allows you to switch between Spanish or English. An example is shown in the figure below:
